> What is the underlying filesystem? 

  I'm on local disc of a win xp box so I would suppose it's ntfs. I'm currently on holiday, but I can check it when I use my work computer the next time. 
  I'd like to stress that I have had no problem like this w/ the previous version of ajdt on eclipse 3.1.2


> Are you using linked source folders?

  I'm not aware of such a feature so I'd say I'm not. I think I had defined dependencies to the bin (where the .class files go) folders of other projects (i.e. added them to the build path). I can check this if this is significant.

Thanks for the information.
I've looked through the stack trace in more detail, and the code definitely believes your project is a linked resource, which is a resource outside of the workspace. It is possible to create linked folders within a project, but in this case it appears that the whole project is outside of the workspace. This can happen when you choose "create project from existing source" in the new project wizard - did you do that? If so, could you try creating a new project in the workspace, and copying the source across? I still don't know why refreshing a project with an external location would fail like this, but at least if local projects work ok, you have a workaround. As another test, could you try creating a new simple test project from existing source, to see if that fails also.
please reopen when you have time to respond to the above. thanks
